comic.title: Comic strip
comic.description: Choose this path to create a comic strip, you will have one week for each step:

steps.detailed: Draw the main character, for example focus on emotions, clothes, body shape...
Draw the universe, for example focus on sets, vehicles... You can study codes and clich√©s which allow readers to identify the universe (architecture studies, iconography, costumes...).
Draw allies and adversaries. As with all characters you can focus on emotions, clothes, body shapes...
Develop the storyboard. Keep in mind the framing, the setting, the positioning of the characters (their action and their mentality). Adds dialog bubbles and framed explanatory texts.
Start sketching the boards to get as close as possible to the final result before ink, colors and shadows.
This is the final touch, moving on to inking, coloring, and shading. It's almost finished !

comic.tips: Tip: move on to drawing after developing the idea (2-3 sentences), the synopsis (around 4 pages - chronological) and the sequencer (around 15 pages - described scene by scene, no dialogue or long description, neutral text).

practice.title: Exercises
practice.description: Choose this path to keep a daily drawing practice, you will be able to select a new theme each week.
practice.tips: Tip: take a specific subject (hands, facial expressions, cats, rocks...).

theory.title: Theory
theory.description: Choose this path to strengthen your drawing foundations, focusing on one subject per week:
theory.tips: Tip: you can pick these subjects for the exercises.

start.title: Practice
start.body: Start your session. Take the time allotted to draw according to the objectives you have defined.

done.body: Congratulations! You have completed a session, you can now rest or continue drawing.
